title: Quincy mayor proposes reduced raise after backlash over 79 percent increase
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The proposal will revise Mayor Thomas Koch’s expected raise from $285,000 to $225,000 when it takes effect in 2028.
Quincy Mayor Thomas Koch has revised his proposal for a raise for 2028 after the initial raise was met with backlash.
Pat Greenhouse/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Falcons coach compares Drake Maye to reigning NFL MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “His mobility, his arm strength, the way he can take a game over with both facets of the game.
So he's going to be — he's a problem.
” Josh Allen was handed a loss by Drake Maye and the Patriots earlier this month.

title: Brad Marchand steps away from the Panthers to help a friend whose daughter died of cancer
author: The Associated Press
bullets: NHL Marchand is serving as a guest coach in a game that is a fundraiser for the family of 10-year-old Selah Panacci-MacCallum.
Florida Panthers left wing Brad Marchand taps his heart during a standing ovation during a break in the first period of a game, Tuesday, Oct.
21, 2025, in Boston.

title: Former Mass. police captain indicted, arrested for alleged booking room assault
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime Video footage shows the former police captain suddenly grabbing and tackling a man being detained.
Ex-Lawrence police captain Michael Mangan has been indicted for allegedly assaulting Sodiq Amusat in 2023.

Essex County District Attorney's Office A former Lawrence police captain has been indicted by a grand jury for allegedly assaulting a detainee and falsifying reports about the incident, court filings show.

title: What Patriots players said about Kyle Dugger, Keion White trades
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “Those are two of my closest friends I talk to, but I mean, it’s a business at the end of the day.
" Kyle Dugger was traded by the Patriots on Tuesday.

title: Marcus Jones explains motivation, process that led to new contract with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “I signed for a reason.
I trust what [Vrabel] brings to the table.
" Marcus Jones signed a new contract extension on Tuesday.

title: Death of man who died in standoff with Fall River police ruled a suicide, DA says
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner, who performed the man’s autopsy, indicated that his fatal gunshot wound was self-inflicted.
By Darin Zullo October 29, 2025 | 6:51 PM 1 minute to read The death of a man who died in an armed standoff with Fall River police in July has been ruled a suicide, according to prosecutors.

Domonick Knight, 38, of Fall River, suffered a gunshot wound to the head and was later pronounced dead after exchanging gunfire with police in the early hours of July 15, the Bristol County District Attorney’s office said in a statement Wednesday.

title: Trump administration policies could cost Massachusetts billions, report finds
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News A new report from the Greater Boston Chamber of Commerce projects a $5.
9 billion hit to the state’s economy and $515 million in lost tax revenue.
A view of the Harvard Bridge (Massachusetts Ave Bridge) with MIT campus on the right.

title: Mass. drivers are baffled by these new traffic lights — here’s how they work
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Local News Hybrid traffic lights, designed to make crossings safer, are confusing motorists across the state — and some drivers are running red lights.
A pedestrian hybrid beacon in Quincy.
Boston.
